Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the content of the banner by highlighting certain letters to form a profanity, which was not actually present in the original banner.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough supporting evidence to prove that the banner was criticizing the 1986 Philippine EDSA revolution.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the highlighted letters in the doctored image represent the true intention of the banner, without considering alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the banner was actually celebrating the revolution, as shown by multiple images of the same banner without the highlighted letters.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the banner was actually in support of the revolution, as confirmed by multiple images and tweets from the event.
